name: APT39
descr: [APT39](https://attack.mitre.org/groups/G0087) is one of several names for cyber espionage activity conducted by the Iranian Ministry of Intelligence and Security (MOIS) through the front company Rana Intelligence Computing since at least 2014. [APT39](https://attack.mitre.org/groups/G0087) has primarily targeted the travel, hospitality, academic, and telecommunications industries in Iran and across Asia, Africa, Europe, and North America to track individuals and entities considered to be a threat by the MOIS.(Citation: FireEye APT39 Jan 2019)(Citation: Symantec Chafer Dec 2015)(Citation: FBI FLASH APT39 September 2020)(Citation: Dept. of Treasury Iran Sanctions September 2020)(Citation: DOJ Iran Indictments September 2020)

subtechniques.name: Web Protocols
subtechniques.descr: [APT39](https://attack.mitre.org/groups/G0087) has used HTTP in communications with C2.(Citation: BitDefender Chafer May 2020)(Citation: FBI FLASH APT39 September 2020)

subtechniques.name: DNS
subtechniques.descr: [APT39](https://attack.mitre.org/groups/G0087) has used remote access tools that leverage DNS in communications with C2.(Citation: BitDefender Chafer May 2020)

subtechniques.name: Archive via Utility
subtechniques.descr: [APT39](https://attack.mitre.org/groups/G0087) has used WinRAR and 7-Zip to compress an archive stolen data.(Citation: FireEye APT39 Jan 2019)

technique_table_data.name: BITS Jobs
technique_table_data.descr: [APT39](https://attack.mitre.org/groups/G0087) has used the BITS protocol to exfiltrate stolen data from a compromised host.(Citation: FBI FLASH APT39 September 2020)

subtechniques.name: Registry Run Keys / Startup Folder
subtechniques.descr: [APT39](https://attack.mitre.org/groups/G0087) has maintained persistence using the startup folder.(Citation: FireEye APT39 Jan 2019)

subtechniques.name: Shortcut Modification
subtechniques.descr: [APT39](https://attack.mitre.org/groups/G0087) has modified LNK shortcuts.(Citation: FireEye APT39 Jan 2019)

technique_table_data.name: Brute Force
technique_table_data.descr: [APT39](https://attack.mitre.org/groups/G0087) has used Ncrack to reveal credentials.(Citation: FireEye APT39 Jan 2019)

technique_table_data.name: Clipboard Data
technique_table_data.descr: [APT39](https://attack.mitre.org/groups/G0087) has used tools capable of stealing contents of the clipboard.(Citation: Symantec Chafer February 2018)

technique_table_data.name: Command and Scripting Interpreter

subtechniques.name: PowerShell
subtechniques.descr: [APT39](https://attack.mitre.org/groups/G0087) has used PowerShell to execute malicious code.(Citation: BitDefender Chafer May 2020)(Citation: Symantec Chafer February 2018)

subtechniques.name: Visual Basic
subtechniques.descr: [APT39](https://attack.mitre.org/groups/G0087) has utilized malicious VBS scripts in malware.(Citation: FBI FLASH APT39 September 2020)

subtechniques.name: Python
subtechniques.descr: [APT39](https://attack.mitre.org/groups/G0087) has used a command line utility and a network scanner written in python.(Citation: BitDefender Chafer May 2020)(Citation: FBI FLASH APT39 September 2020)

subtechniques.name: AutoHotKey & AutoIT
subtechniques.descr: [APT39](https://attack.mitre.org/groups/G0087) has utilized AutoIt malware scripts embedded in Microsoft Office documents or malicious links.(Citation: FBI FLASH APT39 September 2020)

technique_table_data.descr: [APT39](https://attack.mitre.org/groups/G0087) has utilized custom scripts to perform internal reconnaissance.(Citation: FireEye APT39 Jan 2019)(Citation: FBI FLASH APT39 September 2020)

subtechniques.name: Local Account
subtechniques.descr: [APT39](https://attack.mitre.org/groups/G0087) has created accounts on multiple compromised hosts to perform actions within the network.(Citation: BitDefender Chafer May 2020)

technique_table_data.name: Credentials from Password Stores
technique_table_data.descr: [APT39](https://attack.mitre.org/groups/G0087) has used the Smartftp Password Decryptor tool to decrypt FTP passwords.(Citation: BitDefender Chafer May 2020)

technique_table_data.name: Data from Local System
technique_table_data.descr: [APT39](https://attack.mitre.org/groups/G0087) has used various tools to steal files from the compromised host.(Citation: Symantec Chafer February 2018)(Citation: FBI FLASH APT39 September 2020)

subtechniques.name: Local Data Staging
subtechniques.descr: [APT39](https://attack.mitre.org/groups/G0087) has utilized tools to aggregate data prior to exfiltration.(Citation: FBI FLASH APT39 September 2020)

technique_table_data.name: Deobfuscate/Decode Files or Information
technique_table_data.descr: [APT39](https://attack.mitre.org/groups/G0087) has used malware to decrypt encrypted CAB files.(Citation: FBI FLASH APT39 September 2020)

subtechniques.name: AppInit DLLs
subtechniques.descr: [APT39](https://attack.mitre.org/groups/G0087) has used malware to set LoadAppInit_DLLs in the Registry key SOFTWARE\Microsoft\Windows NT\CurrentVersion\Windows in order to establish persistence.(Citation: FBI FLASH APT39 September 2020)

technique_table_data.name: Exfiltration Over C2 Channel
technique_table_data.descr: [APT39](https://attack.mitre.org/groups/G0087) has exfiltrated stolen victim data through C2 communications.(Citation: FBI FLASH APT39 September 2020)

technique_table_data.name: Exploit Public-Facing Application
technique_table_data.descr: [APT39](https://attack.mitre.org/groups/G0087) has used SQL injection for initial compromise.(Citation: Symantec Chafer February 2018)

technique_table_data.name: File and Directory Discovery
technique_table_data.descr: [APT39](https://attack.mitre.org/groups/G0087) has used tools with the ability to search for files on a compromised host.(Citation: FBI FLASH APT39 September 2020)

subtechniques.name: File Deletion
subtechniques.descr: [APT39](https://attack.mitre.org/groups/G0087) has used malware to delete files after they are deployed on a compromised host.(Citation: FBI FLASH APT39 September 2020)

technique_table_data.name: Ingress Tool Transfer
technique_table_data.descr: [APT39](https://attack.mitre.org/groups/G0087) has downloaded tools to compromised hosts.(Citation: Symantec Chafer February 2018)(Citation: FBI FLASH APT39 September 2020)

technique_table_data.name: Input Capture

subtechniques.name: Keylogging
subtechniques.descr: [APT39](https://attack.mitre.org/groups/G0087) has used tools for capturing keystrokes.(Citation: Symantec Chafer February 2018)(Citation: FBI FLASH APT39 September 2020)

technique_table_data.descr: [APT39](https://attack.mitre.org/groups/G0087) has utilized tools to capture mouse movements.(Citation: FBI FLASH APT39 September 2020)

subtechniques.name: Match Legitimate Resource Name or Location
subtechniques.descr: [APT39](https://attack.mitre.org/groups/G0087) has used malware disguised as Mozilla Firefox and a tool named mfevtpse.exe to proxy C2 communications, closely mimicking a legitimate McAfee file mfevtps.exe.(Citation: BitDefender Chafer May 2020)(Citation: FBI FLASH APT39 September 2020)

technique_table_data.name: Network Service Discovery
technique_table_data.descr: [APT39](https://attack.mitre.org/groups/G0087) has used [CrackMapExec](https://attack.mitre.org/software/S0488) and a custom port scanner known as BLUETORCH for network scanning.(Citation: FireEye APT39 Jan 2019)(Citation: BitDefender Chafer May 2020)

technique_table_data.name: Network Share Discovery
technique_table_data.descr: [APT39](https://attack.mitre.org/groups/G0087) has used the post exploitation tool [CrackMapExec](https://attack.mitre.org/software/S0488) to enumerate network shares.(Citation: BitDefender Chafer May 2020)

subtechniques.name: Software Packing
subtechniques.descr: [APT39](https://attack.mitre.org/groups/G0087) has packed tools with UPX, and has repacked a modified version of [Mimikatz](https://attack.mitre.org/software/S0002) to thwart anti-virus detection.(Citation: FireEye APT39 Jan 2019)(Citation: BitDefender Chafer May 2020)

subtechniques.name: Encrypted/Encoded File
subtechniques.descr: [APT39](https://attack.mitre.org/groups/G0087) has used malware to drop encrypted CAB files.(Citation: FBI FLASH APT39 September 2020)

subtechniques.name: Tool
subtechniques.descr: [APT39](https://attack.mitre.org/groups/G0087) has modified and used customized versions of publicly-available tools like PLINK and [Mimikatz](https://attack.mitre.org/software/S0002).(Citation: BitDefender Chafer May 2020)(Citation: IBM ITG07 June 2019)

technique_table_data.name: OS Credential Dumping
technique_table_data.descr: [APT39](https://attack.mitre.org/groups/G0087) has used different versions of Mimikatz to obtain credentials.(Citation: BitDefender Chafer May 2020)

subtechniques.name: LSASS Memory
subtechniques.descr: [APT39](https://attack.mitre.org/groups/G0087) has used Mimikatz, Windows Credential Editor and ProcDump to dump credentials.(Citation: FireEye APT39 Jan 2019)

subtechniques.name: Spearphishing Attachment
subtechniques.descr: [APT39](https://attack.mitre.org/groups/G0087) leveraged spearphishing emails with malicious attachments to initially compromise victims.(Citation: FireEye APT39 Jan 2019)(Citation: Symantec Chafer February 2018)(Citation: FBI FLASH APT39 September 2020)

subtechniques.name: Spearphishing Link
subtechniques.descr: [APT39](https://attack.mitre.org/groups/G0087) leveraged spearphishing emails with malicious links to initially compromise victims.(Citation: FireEye APT39 Jan 2019)(Citation: FBI FLASH APT39 September 2020)

subtechniques.name: Internal Proxy
subtechniques.descr: [APT39](https://attack.mitre.org/groups/G0087) used custom tools to create SOCK5 and custom protocol proxies between infected hosts.(Citation: FireEye APT39 Jan 2019)(Citation: BitDefender Chafer May 2020)

subtechniques.name: External Proxy
subtechniques.descr: [APT39](https://attack.mitre.org/groups/G0087) has used various tools to proxy C2 communications.(Citation: BitDefender Chafer May 2020)

technique_table_data.name: Query Registry
technique_table_data.descr: [APT39](https://attack.mitre.org/groups/G0087) has used various strains of malware to query the Registry.(Citation: FBI FLASH APT39 September 2020)

subtechniques.name: Remote Desktop Protocol
subtechniques.descr: [APT39](https://attack.mitre.org/groups/G0087) has been seen using RDP for lateral movement and persistence, in some cases employing the rdpwinst tool for mangement of multiple sessions.(Citation: FireEye APT39 Jan 2019)(Citation: BitDefender Chafer May 2020)

subtechniques.name: SMB/Windows Admin Shares
subtechniques.descr: [APT39](https://attack.mitre.org/groups/G0087) has used SMB for lateral movement.(Citation: Symantec Chafer February 2018)

subtechniques.name: SSH
subtechniques.descr: [APT39](https://attack.mitre.org/groups/G0087) used secure shell (SSH) to move laterally among their targets.(Citation: FireEye APT39 Jan 2019)

technique_table_data.name: Remote System Discovery
technique_table_data.descr: [APT39](https://attack.mitre.org/groups/G0087) has used [NBTscan](https://attack.mitre.org/software/S0590) and custom tools to discover remote systems.(Citation: FireEye APT39 Jan 2019)(Citation: BitDefender Chafer May 2020)(Citation: Symantec Chafer February 2018)

subtechniques.name: Scheduled Task
subtechniques.descr: [APT39](https://attack.mitre.org/groups/G0087) has created scheduled tasks for persistence.(Citation: FireEye APT39 Jan 2019)(Citation: BitDefender Chafer May 2020)(Citation: FBI FLASH APT39 September 2020)

technique_table_data.name: Screen Capture
technique_table_data.descr: [APT39](https://attack.mitre.org/groups/G0087) has used a screen capture utility to take screenshots on a compromised host.(Citation: Symantec Chafer February 2018)(Citation: FBI FLASH APT39 September 2020)

subtechniques.name: Web Shell
subtechniques.descr: [APT39](https://attack.mitre.org/groups/G0087) has installed ANTAK and ASPXSPY web shells.(Citation: FireEye APT39 Jan 2019)

subtechniques.name: Code Signing Policy Modification
subtechniques.descr: [APT39](https://attack.mitre.org/groups/G0087) has used malware to turn off the RequireSigned feature which ensures only signed DLLs can be run on Windows.(Citation: FBI FLASH APT39 September 2020)

technique_table_data.name: System Owner/User Discovery
technique_table_data.descr: [APT39](https://attack.mitre.org/groups/G0087) used [Remexi](https://attack.mitre.org/software/S0375) to collect usernames from the system.(Citation: Symantec Chafer Dec 2015)

subtechniques.name: Service Execution
subtechniques.descr: [APT39](https://attack.mitre.org/groups/G0087) has used post-exploitation tools including RemCom and the Non-sucking Service Manager (NSSM) to execute processes.(Citation: BitDefender Chafer May 2020)(Citation: Symantec Chafer February 2018)

subtechniques.name: Malicious Link
subtechniques.descr: [APT39](https://attack.mitre.org/groups/G0087) has sent spearphishing emails in an attempt to lure users to click on a malicious link.(Citation: FireEye APT39 Jan 2019)(Citation: FBI FLASH APT39 September 2020)

subtechniques.name: Malicious File
subtechniques.descr: [APT39](https://attack.mitre.org/groups/G0087) has sent spearphishing emails in an attempt to lure users to click on a malicious attachment.(Citation: FireEye APT39 Jan 2019)(Citation: BitDefender Chafer May 2020)(Citation: Symantec Chafer February 2018)(Citation: FBI FLASH APT39 September 2020)

technique_table_data.name: Valid Accounts
technique_table_data.descr: [APT39](https://attack.mitre.org/groups/G0087) has used stolen credentials to compromise Outlook Web Access (OWA).(Citation: FireEye APT39 Jan 2019)

subtechniques.name: Bidirectional Communication
subtechniques.descr: [APT39](https://attack.mitre.org/groups/G0087) has communicated with C2 through files uploaded to and downloaded from DropBox.(Citation: BitDefender Chafer May 2020)

software_data.name: CrackMapExec
software_data.descr: (Citation: FireEye APT39 Jan 2019)(Citation: BitDefender Chafer May 2020)

techniques.name: Masquerading
techniques.sub_name: Match Legitimate Resource Name or Location

software_data.name: Mimikatz
software_data.descr: (Citation: FireEye APT39 Jan 2019)(Citation: BitDefender Chafer May 2020)(Citation: Dark Reading APT39 JAN 2019)(Citation: Symantec Chafer February 2018)

software_data.name: PsExec
software_data.descr: (Citation: FireEye APT39 Jan 2019)(Citation: BitDefender Chafer May 2020)(Citation: Symantec Chafer February 2018)

software_data.name: Remexi
software_data.descr: (Citation: Symantec Chafer Dec 2015)(Citation: Securelist Remexi Jan 2019)(Citation: Symantec Chafer February 2018)

software_data.name: Windows Credential Editor
software_data.descr: (Citation: FireEye APT39 Jan 2019)(Citation: Dark Reading APT39 JAN 2019)

alias_descriptions.name: ITG07
alias_descriptions.descr: (Citation: FBI FLASH APT39 September 2020)(Citation: Dept. of Treasury Iran Sanctions September 2020)(Citation: DOJ Iran Indictments September 2020)

alias_descriptions.name: Chafer
alias_descriptions.descr: Activities associated with APT39 largely align with a group publicly referred to as Chafer.(Citation: FireEye APT39 Jan 2019)(Citation: Symantec Chafer Dec 2015)(Citation: Dark Reading APT39 JAN 2019)(Citation: FBI FLASH APT39 September 2020)(Citation: Dept. of Treasury Iran Sanctions September 2020)(Citation: DOJ Iran Indictments September 2020)

Crowdstrike GTR2020 Mar 2020.description: Crowdstrike. (2020, March 2). 2020 Global Threat Report. Retrieved December 11, 2020.

Dept. of Treasury Iran Sanctions Septemb.description: Dept. of Treasury. (2020, September 17). Treasury Sanctions Cyber Actors Backed by Iranian Intelligence. Retrieved December 10, 2020.

DOJ Iran Indictments September 2020.description: DOJ. (2020, September 17). Department of Justice and Partner Departments and Agencies Conduct Coordinated Actions to Disrupt and Deter Iranian Malicious Cyber Activities Targeting the United States and the Broader International Community. Retrieved December 10, 2020.

FBI FLASH APT39 September 2020.description: FBI. (2020, September 17). Indicators of Compromise Associated with Rana Intelligence Computing, also known as Advanced Persistent Threat 39, Chafer, Cadelspy, Remexi, and ITG07. Retrieved December 10, 2020.

FireEye APT39 Jan 2019.description: Hawley et al. (2019, January 29). APT39: An Iranian Cyber Espionage Group Focused on Personal Information. Retrieved February 19, 2019.

Dark Reading APT39 JAN 2019.description: Higgins, K. (2019, January 30). Iran Ups its Traditional Cyber Espionage Tradecraft. Retrieved May 22, 2020.

Symantec Chafer Dec 2015.description: Symantec Security Response. (2015, December 7). Iran-based attackers use back door threats to spy on Middle Eastern targets. Retrieved April 17, 2019.

BitDefender Chafer May 2020.description: Rusu, B. (2020, May 21). Iranian Chafer APT Targeted Air Transportation and Government in Kuwait and Saudi Arabia. Retrieved May 22, 2020.

Symantec Chafer February 2018.description: Symantec. (2018, February 28). Chafer: Latest Attacks Reveal Heightened Ambitions. Retrieved May 22, 2020.

IBM ITG07 June 2019.description: McMillen, D. Sperry, C. (2019, June 14). Observations of ITG07 Cyber Operations. Retrieved May 17, 2021.

Unit 42 MechaFlounder March 2019.description: Falcone, R. (2019, March 4). New Python-Based Payload MechaFlounder Used by Chafer. Retrieved May 27, 2020.

Securelist Remexi Jan 2019.description: Legezo, D. (2019, January 30). Chafer used Remexi malware to spy on Iran-based foreign diplomatic entities. Retrieved April 17, 2019.
